text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly addresses the burden of proof for goods imported directly from third countries (China) into NI. It states: \"Goods from third countries (China, etc.) arriving directly in NI are **presumed at risk** unless the importer can demonstrate they meet the conditions for the green lane.\" This directly satisfies the requirement of the criterion, which is to explain that the presumption for all goods not covered by the Windsor Framework arrangements, including goods directly imported to NI from 3rd countries, remains that they are 'at risk'.", "criterion_id": "2f0e047c-09d7-40ee-a04e-af21eca6630e"}
